story:
About this project

FeedArt is a revolutionary cool gadget with a Smartphone App, designed for real-time monitoring your baby's breastfeeding, help tracking his proper growth, improving natural breastfeeding and making it possible for your love to be measured.

The major difficulty with breastfeeding is to know in real-time how much your baby has nursed, for some psychological and physiological malnutrition may occur. Up until now, no reliable, accurate, real time and with no interference of the baby's breastfeeding cycle was available. This fact prevented your baby from eating freely; making him and you nervous while substantially reducing the quantity he eats.

With FeedArt's application, for the first time, your baby may nurse freely while you are able to keep track of the quantities he eats while he eats.

This newly designed digital gadget presents accurate detailed information on your Smartphone which you can also share on-line with the baby's Doctor and your breastfeeding consultant, regarding each breastfeeding cycle.

It keeps historical data and comparable to past breastfeeding and common averages for the baby's age.

Your innovative FeedArt will show you information needed concerning your baby's feeds such as: Quantities, flow, amount per breastfeeding comparable breastfeeding history and more will be graphically presented on your Smartphone screen.

FeedArt will keep a log of all the information and show you daily & monthly eating habits, so you can keep track of the baby's proper development.

It’s a known fact!

Breastfeeding/nursing is recommended based on scientific research. Breastfeed baby’s where show to have improved immune systems, less likely to get sick or infections and allergies.

Breastfeeding/nursing doesn't always go smoothly and it is difficult to know how much your baby has actually consumed. Women around the world are aware of this fact and are searching for ways to keep track of their baby's feeding habits and volume.

Worldwide statistics show that up to 35% of women that breastfeed say they have to know exactly how much their baby has consumed. Our newly designed product measures your baby's consumption precisely and evaluates the milk flow.

How it works

With FeedArt's digital product and Smartphone App you simply place the bio-compatible silicone ring on your breast areola, around the nipple without interference during breastfeeding. The data collected by the digital device is then transmitted to your Smartphone for processing and presenting a real-time output concerning your baby's breastfeeding.

FeedArt joins the fast growing technology of cutting edge Smartphone Apps showing real time information by tracking your body's activity. 

FeedArt App will work with iPhone, Android and Blackberry.

Use this link for further technical information.

Why do we need the support of the Indiegogo crow

We have already developed the measuring technology and the product and tested the prototype shown above.

We have also characterized and designed the application and its user interface and completed other phases of the product.

However, there are still more creative elements ahead of us: Final product design and completing the interactive Smartphone applications, listing and starting serial production for supplying the FeedArt to you – Indiegogo backers, before starting marketing and sales.

We are trying to revolutionize the world of breastfeeding by implementing an innovative design for mothers' and babies around the world.

By backing the project, you will join the FeedArt Revolution and Breastfeeding evolution and pre-order FeedArt, to be one of the first in the world to use it.

Only together we can do it !

http://www.situgen.com
http://www.lifebank.co.il

 

FAQ

1.       What is the measuring component in the device?
Piezoelectric Sensors.

2.       What is the device made from?  
A Bio-Compatible Silicone.

3.       Where exactly should it be located?   
On the breast areola, around the Nipple, which is does not interfere with the baby's breastfeeding.

4.       Will our baby like the FeedArt?
FeedArt will not be noticed by the baby, it's made from a very thin and flexible Silicone, it does not interfere with the baby's breastfeeding.

5.       Has FeedArt been tested?  
It has already been clinically tested and will be retested following each and every future stage of designing.

6.       Is there any radiation effect that can harm the user or the baby?  
 Not at all and the device will be regulated by the FDA.

7.       How reliable is the data accepted from the FeedArt?   
Testing, trials and calibration ensure reliable data and results.

8.       What exactly doe's FeedArt include?
A Silicone pad, a measuring element, a connector to your Smartphones and an Application for processing an presenting the info.

 

Project By

We are Miki Shacham, the master mind behind FeedArt, Prof. David Elad, the scientist of FeedArt and Eyal Rom, a business developer as well as co-planner.

Three of us have a distinguished career and proven track record each in our own field of expertise. As parents we truly believe in this innovative idea that will revolutionize the world of parenthood. By implementing the use of FeedArt we wish to help mothers around the world to better breastfeed and track their baby's growth as well as development. Their love can be measured.

Project By

We are Miki Shacham, the master mind behind FeedArt, Prof. David Elad, the scientist of FeedArt and Eyal Rom, a business developer as well as co-planner.
Three of us have a distinguished career and proven track record each in our own field of expertise. As parents we truly believe in this innovative idea that will revolutionize the world of parenthood. By implementing the use of FeedArt we wish to help mothers around the world to better breastfeed and track their baby's growth as well as development. Their love can be measured.

Mr. Shacham has already established several successful startups in Israel in various fields mainly those focused in User-Interface design and Biomed. Fascinated by the endless possibilities in these fields, he explored this new world while basing himself as a leading figure known for his devoted work, innovative ideas, many exiting article and original research. Mr. Shacham is a the top expert in the starting new initiatives in various fields, from establishing through researching, developing, characterization, operating, and all manufacturing methods, up until marketing.

Prof. David Elad, a senior member of the Faculty of Engineering, Tel-Aviv University and has been a visiting scholar at Imperial College London, MIT, Northwestern University, Drexel University, Georgia Tech, City College NY and Columbia University. He is a fellow of the AIMBE and BMES, and a member of the World Council for Biomechanics.
His current research activities include Computational Analysis and Quantitative In Vivo Evaluation of Nasal Function, Analysis of the Inhomogeneous Performance of Respiratory Muscles, Analysis of Breathing Signals for Detection of Upper Airway Obstructions, Study the Role of Uterine Peristalsis in Human Conception, Investigation of Transport Characteristics during Embryo Transfer and Evaluation of Feto-Maternal Blood Flow in the Human Placenta.

Mr. Eyal Rom, experienced in business development of High-Tech companies for over 25 years. Mr. Rom served as the president of C-nario Inc., based in the USA. Mr. Rom was a Business Development Manager in the Israeli subsidiary of Digital Corp., where he was responsible for the company's activities in the military sector with a focus on new markets development and creating business opportunities for expanding digital's customer base.
Mr. Rom holds a BA in Economics and Business Administration.

story:
We are an international group of students studying MA Fashion Curation at the London College of Fashion. We have been given the task of curating a fashion exhibition from start to finish, including selecting a theme, choosing and acquiring objects, securing a venue and raising the funds to make this exhibition a reality. Our exhibition will be staged at the end of March at a to-be-determined venue in London.

re:address will explore the contemporary perception of historical garments as precious objects; either as a relic of the past preserved in the museum or its revival into a second life as vintage clothing. With a focus on British heritage and design, re:address will examine the motives behind the resurrection of objects from the past and will portray the eclectic landscape of vintage in London today.

Juxtaposing pieces from the London College of Fashion and Central Saint Martin's archives, London vintage shops and from our own wardrobes, re:address will represent ideas of nostalgia preserved from personal memories, relics acquired for inspiration and collective memory, and new style identities created by modern wearers who re-enact and re-interpret.

Your support will help us to:
* Hire a venue
* Transport objects safely and securely
* Purchase display materials
* Produce an exhibition catalogue
* Print promotional materials and invitations
* Host an amazing opening party


Your support will ensure that we are able to put on a fantastic exhibition - Thank you!!

MA Fashion Curation

Matteo Augello
Jin Young Bae
Xenia Capacete
Daniel Caulfield-Sriklad
Kristina Chambers
Athena Chen
Anysa Cianni
Chelsea Doyle
Francesca Ferlin
Ricky Kim
Fiona Elizabeth Mckay
Jennifer Munday
Jennifer Melissa Rice
Sarah-Jane Simpson
Renee Van Der Hoek

mafashioncuration2012@gmail.com


Ps: help us promote this page and post it to your friends!

story:
NOTE: we didn't make our first-tier goal, so we're suspending fund-raising...

  Thank you to everyone who has shared this site and especially to those who've contributed.  Apparently there simply wasn't time to gain enough interest to fund the patent appeal, so as of Dec. 24th, the patent application has now gone abandoned.  This means patent protection is now unavailable, and the concept is now "public-domain"; no-one can now have exclusive rights to the technology, which makes it harder to interest a manufacturer, and harder yet to secure royalties.


   Please share any comments you have about the KwikFoot(tm) design or any aspect of the Empowerment Engineering concept.  Again, thank you so much for your interest.


  KwikFoot(tm): fitness and fun without the hassle!

 

  In seconds, switch from ice skates to inline roller skates, quad skates, alpine skis, nordic skis, snowshoes, snowboards, even water skis, wakeboards or swimfins, all using the same comfortable footwear you wore from home.  No separate, bulky boots to lug around and change into; just snap in and enjoy!

   I'm Gordon Belles; with my background in mechanical engineering and product development, I started American Independence Technologies LLC to create products which help us be our best, instead of exploiting our weaknesses.  The "Empowerment Engineering" principles (discussed below), which aid in this, include versatility, efficiency, interchangeability/modularity and economy, featured traits of the KwikFoot(tm) attachment system, the first of our concepts being readied for market.


Let's make this happen!


The short story:

   Time is very short!  We must raise the first $1,000 the next few days to keep our patent application alive, and a minimum of another $15,000 for legal work by mid-January.  The remainder, after fees and perks - $43,218.00 - will be needed to realistically continue prototyping (of additional footwear and more variety of equipment - skis, snowboard, snowshoes, etc.), retire related debt and free some time to work with potential licensees.  
   If funds are sufficient, I would also very much like to take the time to begin a discussion forum on Empowerment Engineering, and get more people aware and involved in working out just which properties of products actually help us reach toward our potential (see below).

The project so far:

   I've taken KwikFoot(tm) from concept to optimized configuration, built the working prototype shown in the video above (using inline skates as the demonstrated equipment), filed and followed up on application for U.S. patent protection (to secure limited-time exclusive rights to several unique aspects of the design), and have been seeking licensees for manufacture and distribution.

Expenditures:

   to this point these include over $1,400 in prototyping equipment and materials (fabrication was done by me; man-hours included below), and $21,218 in legal and patent office fees ($16,485 already paid, plus $4733 still owed), additional expenses of about $1,200 (office supplies and equipment, presentation materials, travel to present to licensee candidates, etc.), and well over 5,000 man-hours in research, design, prototyping, patent preparation (working with Barnes & Thornburg), preparing presentation materials, and communication with potential licensees.  
   These have stretched both my time and our finances to the limits.  In addition, a flood this summer destroyed my milling equipment, saws and other fabrication tools (some previously owned, some purchased for this project).  The damage was only partly covered by insurance, and these items will need replacing before further prototyping.  This will require about $2500.

Licensing Status:

   I have approached a number of manufacturers as potential licensees; several of these have expressed interest, but so far have been unable to commit to production with patent still pending (not yet granted).  With recent strain on finances, I've been unable to put much time into scouting and developing licensee prospects.

Patent Status:

   Why time is so urgent: the patent examiner issued the first "office action" (evaluation of the patent application) early last year, flatly denying a patent, saying each of the features we claim are contained in some existing inventions ("prior art").  Some examiners do this routinely, putting burden of proof on the inventor to specify how his invention is different from each prior art cited.
   My patent attorney and I responded, correcting some minor technical errors the examiner cited, and pointing out specifically how the features of my invention differ from the prior art.
   To our surprise, the examiner basically ignored the content of our response and re-asserted that each of these features was contained in the prior art specified, and promptly made this second office action final, leaving an appeal the only real recourse.
   My attorney and I both believe we have very strong grounds for appeal, but without additional financing, we've been unable to make that case.  With the flood this summer and a downturn at my day-job, I still owe the attorney for much of the first (unexpectely in-depth - and expensive) office action response.
   Below, you'll find full information on the grounds for the patent appeal; we hope you'll decide this is worth your supporting.

Financial Status:

   Having only recently discovered crowdfunding, I've been feverishly assembling a campaign here to beat the Dec. 24 deadline for response.  My attorney needs a day or two to prepare this response, so really the $1000 retainer would be needed no later than Monday the 23rd, if not sooner!  I'll be calling him soon to firm up  that deadline and post an update as soon as we know.

Where do we go from here?

   If we succeed in getting patent protection, the fact that you all will have helped this happen will be a strong selling point to any potential licensees; not only will we have patent protection, but we also can show a ready-made, enthusiastic market!  Your support not only helps with patenting, it can help convince a manufacturer to commit to production and marketing!
   And we definitely want to hear any feedback you have about the KwikFoot(tm) roll-out, the whole idea of Empowerment Engineering, or the Indiegogo campaign itself.  For instance: how much of your support do you want to go to pay for perks?  We have budgeted about 5% for perks.  A few starter perks are shown below; we want to provide tangible reminders of our gratitude, and ways to show your active interest and involvement, and to get others to be aware and involved.  Please let us know what you'd like to see!
   Of course, patent approval is never guaranteed, raising the question: if we fail to raise the amount necessary for an appeal, or if the appeal is finally denied, what next?  We do need to retire the debt from the patent work to-date, and I have a host of other projects in the wings; but we would still need to determine whether to continue to try to get KwikFoot(tm) manufactured without patent protection, try to go into production ourselves, or move on to another project.  If this should happen, your input would be invaluable to help us choose the right path.

  Where your support will go:

  $1,000.00   -retainer for attorney's response (needed by Dec.19)
$15,000.00   -retainer for Patent Office Appeal
   $4733.00   -outstanding patent attorney balance
$16,485.00   -outstanding debt from previous legal fees
$10,000.00   -further prototyping (equipment replacement, materials, labor) $10,000.00   -licensee contact: time, travel and promotional materials
  $2,000.00   -set up website/blog/discussion forum on Empowerment Engineering
   $3117.00   -perks: about 2% to thank you and help spread the word!
  $2,597.00   -indiegogo's campaign fee   
$64,932.00   -TOTAL

Any additional amounts will go toward future projects, as well as any unanticipated expenses involved in bringing KwikFoot(tm) to market.


        

          


My passion: Empowerment Engineering


   The most under-utilized resource in the world must be human potential.  With every engineering choice, we can encourage individual excellence, or exploit human weakness.  My name is Gordon Belles.  After studying Mechanical Engineering at Washington State U, Liberal Arts at Grace College and Physics at Purdue, and working in product development and engineering at Irwin Research and Development, Gulfstream Coach and Colbin Tool Company, my wife Cindy and I chose to start American Independence Technologies LLC to bring to life products which help us all be our best; using and developing our creativity, skills, knowledge, courage, compassion and overall competence.  I like to term this concept Empowerment Engineering.

   Examples abound of the opposite approach: teaser prices for printers using expensive proprietary cartridges, products with a deceptive appearance for bait-and-switch marketing, disposability / planned obsolescence, over-specialization, pandering to addictions: all cynical attempts to take advantage of unwary buyers, instead of appealing to discerning buyers by supplying valuable means to reach toward their potential.

   This is embodied by product qualities such as versatility, fault-tolerance, durability, de-centralization, modular design, interchangeability, ease of servicing, and value through efficiency, all while ensuring users' true needs are met.  

   From both an economic and environmental standpoint, the resulting increased efficiency reduces waste, consumes fewer resources and generates better conditions for all.  From a business standpoint, this respect for the end-user builds a customer base (and ultimately, a culture) which is capable, productive, prosperous, loyal and influential, rather than gullible, fickle, and impoverished.

   We anticipate developing a series of products embodying these principles (mostly for manufacture and distribution by established manufacturers), ranging from door hinges and pipe trimmers to induction systems and jet engines.   As time permits, we'll give you more of the AIT story and continued discussion of Empowerment Engineering.

 KwikFoot(tm) is our first product launch attempt:


        

          


The KwikFoot(tm) Story:

Concept and Development:

   While operating computer labs at Purdue University, I was struck by the way students would leave a classroom building (where wearing skates is not allowed, or practical, since stairs are involved), find a place to sit, pull bulky inline skates (with integral boots) from a large bag, remove their shoes, put on and adjust the skates, put their shoes in the bag, and finally take off to skate to their next class; where they had to reverse the whole process!

   This of course sparked the old TMBABW response from me (There Must Be A Better Way!), and got me thinking of what would be needed to have a separate skate frame which attaches to a flexible-soled boot which could be worn for normal walking.

   So, the design process began: design goals, priorities and parameters were defined, the state of the art was studied, and creative configurations generated (the fun part!).  Then these were narrowed down to the most optimal concept, and this was refined through the prototype process, with results shown in the video above.

   I soon realized the solution: having rigid, clog-resistant attachment points in heel and forefoot could provide the flexible-soled boot with the rigidity needed for skating.  Also, giving each attachment point its own independent lock-up meant we could provide selective rigidity for such a boot.  Skates and alpine skis could fix the boot soles in rigid lockup, while Nordic skis, snowshoes or stretching equipment could lock in only the forefoot or heel, allowing the same boot to flex.  And in all cases, once the equipment is remove, the boot can flex like normal footwear (a big avantage over, say, ski boots!).

  After researching prior art and finalizing a configuration, I purchased equipment and materials, and fabricated the prototype shown in the video above.  Testing shows the attachment to be rigid and strong, allowing full skating maneuvers without wobble or fear of breakage.  The horizontal attachment slots are also self-clearing: a big advantage over attachment systems which insert vertically and leave debris with nowhere to go.  Easily clogging as they are, they make walking in mud or gravel impractical.  KwikFoot(tm) has no such limitation.


Demonstrating flexible sole.

Components Visible

Partial Insertion

Full Insertion (locked in place)

   KwikFoot(tm) fulfills its design objectives: now you don't have to lug around bulky, expensive, specialized boots for each piece of equipment you want to use, or waste time changing footwear and adjusting the fit each time you attach or remove the equipment.  Also, each piece of equipment provides the boot with the right degree of rigiity neee for that application.  With mix-and-match interchangeability, it provides convenience, versatility and economy.

Patenting Process:

   Since my design appeared both novel and non-obvious, we engaged Barnes & Thornburg to help with patenting, and filed a utility patent application in March of 2010. 

  You can see my patent application at the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) at uspto.gov:

  • select: "search for patents" at the top,
  • then "Patent Application Information Retrieval (PAIR)" from the list at the left,
  • then "Public PAIR" from the list on the left, 
  • enter the text from the shown field to prove you're not a robot
  • in "Search for Application", select "publication number" and this takes you to my patent application page, titled "FOOTWEAR WITH INTERFACE FOR ATTACHING DEVICES" (catchy, huh? 8-) 
  • Select the "Published Documents" tab to see the text of my application.
  • From this page, select the "IMAGES" button right above the text, which shows you the application as "printed" pages;
  • From this page, select "Full Document: Full Pages" button on the left, and this will show you the entire patent application, complete with drawings.

  You can also compare the prior art patent (Pratt) which the examiner claims contains all features claimed by my application:

  • back at uspto.gov, select "patents",
  • then under "Patent Searches" on the left, select the "Search Patents & Applications" list;
  • select "Search Full Text and Images" from the list;
  • in "PatFT: Patents" on the left, select "Number Search"
  • enter "6015156" (the patent number for Pratt) in the "Query" box, and hit the "Search" button;
  • This takes you to the text of Pratt's patent; you can view the whole patent using the steps above.

Basis for Our Appeal:

   The examiner maintains that Pratt contains all the elements of our independent claims, specifically that:

  "The sole is configured to be releasably coupled by a substantially rigid connection with a plurality of footwear-mounted devices.  The forefoot and heel receivers are adapted to be coupled in locking engagement with a footwear-mounted device independent of each other" (boldface not original).

  However, the heel receiver disclosed by Pratt is a vertical cylindrical opening which does have a catch, but this retains a connector which is a cylindrical vertical post, and is still free to rotate within the receiver unless restrained by the forefoot connection, thus this does not constitute a substantially rigid connection independent of the forefoot receiver, as required by our claims.

  A further dependent claim of ours does specify the insertion motion to be "substantially coplanar with the sole" (horizontal), which is another distinction from Pratt's heel receiver, yet even this was also rejected by the examiner.

  Also, Pratt discloses a forefoot receiver which is a longitudinal slot without any locking mechanism, save the rear longitudinal stop provided by the heel receiver, which means it specifically can not be coupled in locking engagement independent of the heel receiver, as required by our claims.

  Thus, we believe the independent claim was not anticipated by Pratt, and likewise the remaining claims were objected to on even shakier grounds, citing combinations of obscure aspects of unrelated patents with differing objectives, as being "obvious" to be combined. These other cited patents are Marechal (6,270,089 B1) and Wu (6,042,125).

  Answers to these objections were included in our response to the first office action, though perhaps need to be made even more explicit, and will require an appeal process, since the examiner seems unwilling to reconsider the position of the first office action, and there is no time remaining for anything but a notice to appeal anyway.

How you can help:


   Again, we're almost out of time to act.  If you believe in what we're trying to do, or would just like to see some cool new sporting equipment on the market, please contribute immediately if you can; any amount will help.

   And even if you can't contribute, you can still help by spreading the word to your friends/chat groups/contacts and asking them to do the same!  Indiegogo has handy social media sharing tools you can put in your tweets, facebook pages, etc. to get the word out, and once it snowballs, great things can happen quickly (which is exactly what's needed!).  Please point people to: http://www.igg.me/at/KwikFoot/ to find this campaign.

   Thank you so much for helping any way you can!  Working together, Lord willing, we can actually bring KwikFoot(tm) to reality and make fun and fitness more convenient and accessible to all!
story_txt:
NOTE: we didn't make our first-tier goal, so we're suspending fund-raising...  Thank you to everyone who has shared this site and especially to those who've contributed.  Apparently there simply wasn't time to gain enough interest to fund the patent appeal, so as of Dec. 24th, the patent application has now gone abandoned.  This means patent protection is now unavailable, and the concept is now "public-domain"; no-one can now have exclusive rights to the technology, which makes it harder to interest a manufacturer, and harder yet to secure royalties.   Please share any comments you have about the KwikFoot(tm) design or any aspect of the Empowerment Engineering concept.  Again, thank you so much for your interest.  KwikFoot(tm): fitness and fun without the hassle!
   In seconds, switch from ice skates to inline roller skates, quad skates, alpine skis, nordic skis, snowshoes, snowboards, even water skis, wakeboards or swimfins, all using the same comfortable footwear you wore from home.  No separate, bulky boots to lug around and change into; just snap in and enjoy!   I'm Gordon Belles; with my background in mechanical engineering and product development, I started American Independence Technologies LLC to create products which help us be our best, instead of exploiting our weaknesses.  The "Empowerment Engineering" principles (discussed below), which aid in this, include versatility, efficiency, interchangeability/modularity and economy, featured traits of the KwikFoot(tm) attachment system, the first of our concepts being readied for market.Let's make this happen!The short story:    Time is very short!  We must raise the first $1,000 the next few days to keep our patent application alive, and a minimum of another $15,000 for legal work by mid-January.  The remainder, after fees and perks - $43,218.00 - will be needed to realistically continue prototyping (of additional footwear and more variety of equipment - skis, snowboard, snowshoes, etc.), retire related debt and free some time to work with potential licensees.     If funds are sufficient, I would also very much like to take the time to begin a discussion forum on Empowerment Engineering, and get more people aware and involved in working out just which properties of products actually help us reach toward our potential (see below).The project so far:    I've taken KwikFoot(tm) from concept to optimized configuration, built the working prototype shown in the video above (using inline skates as the demonstrated equipment), filed and followed up on application for U.S. patent protection (to secure limited-time exclusive rights to several unique aspects of the design), and have been seeking licensees for manufacture and distribution.Expenditures:   to this point these include over $1,400 in prototyping equipment and materials (fabrication was done by me; man-hours included below), and $21,218 in legal and patent office fees ($16,485 already paid, plus $4733 still owed), additional expenses of about $1,200 (office supplies and equipment, presentation materials, travel to present to licensee candidates, etc.), and well over 5,000 man-hours in research, design, prototyping, patent preparation (working with Barnes & Thornburg), preparing presentation materials, and communication with potential licensees.     These have stretched both my time and our finances to the limits.  In addition, a flood this summer destroyed my milling equipment, saws and other fabrication tools (some previously owned, some purchased for this project).  The damage was only partly covered by insurance, and these items will need replacing before further prototyping.  This will require about $2500.Licensing Status:   I have approached a number of manufacturers as potential licensees; several of these have expressed interest, but so far have been unable to commit to production with patent still pending (not yet granted).  With recent strain on finances, I've been unable to put much time into scouting and developing licensee prospects.Patent Status:   Why time is so urgent: the patent examiner issued the first "office action" (evaluation of the patent application) early last year, flatly denying a patent, saying each of the features we claim are contained in some existing inventions ("prior art").  Some examiners do this routinely, putting burden of proof on the inventor to specify how his invention is different from each prior art cited.   My patent attorney and I responded, correcting some minor technical errors the examiner cited, and pointing out specifically how the features of my invention differ from the prior art.   To our surprise, the examiner basically ignored the content of our response and re-asserted that each of these features was contained in the prior art specified, and promptly made this second office action final, leaving an appeal the only real recourse.   My attorney and I both believe we have very strong grounds for appeal, but without additional financing, we've been unable to make that case.  With the flood this summer and a downturn at my day-job, I still owe the attorney for much of the first (unexpectely in-depth - and expensive) office action response.   Below, you'll find full information on the grounds for the patent appeal; we hope you'll decide this is worth your supporting.Financial Status:   Having only recently discovered crowdfunding, I've been feverishly assembling a campaign here to beat the Dec. 24 deadline for response.  My attorney needs a day or two to prepare this response, so really the $1000 retainer would be needed no later than Monday the 23rd, if not sooner!  I'll be calling him soon to firm up  that deadline and post an update as soon as we know.Where do we go from here?   If we succeed in getting patent protection, the fact that you all will have helped this happen will be a strong selling point to any potential licensees; not only will we have patent protection, but we also can show a ready-made, enthusiastic market!  Your support not only helps with patenting, it can help convince a manufacturer to commit to production and marketing!   And we definitely want to hear any feedback you have about the KwikFoot(tm) roll-out, the whole idea of Empowerment Engineering, or the Indiegogo campaign itself.  For instance: how much of your support do you want to go to pay for perks?  We have budgeted about 5% for perks.  A few starter perks are shown below; we want to provide tangible reminders of our gratitude, and ways to show your active interest and involvement, and to get others to be aware and involved.  Please let us know what you'd like to see!   Of course, patent approval is never guaranteed, raising the question: if we fail to raise the amount necessary for an appeal, or if the appeal is finally denied, what next?  We do need to retire the debt from the patent work to-date, and I have a host of other projects in the wings; but we would still need to determine whether to continue to try to get KwikFoot(tm) manufactured without patent protection, try to go into production ourselves, or move on to another project.  If this should happen, your input would be invaluable to help us choose the right path.  Where your support will go:  $1,000.00   -retainer for attorney's response (needed by Dec.19)$15,000.00   -retainer for Patent Office Appeal   $4733.00   -outstanding patent attorney balance$16,485.00   -outstanding debt from previous legal fees$10,000.00   -further prototyping (equipment replacement, materials, labor) $10,000.00   -licensee contact: time, travel and promotional materials  $2,000.00   -set up website/blog/discussion forum on Empowerment Engineering   $3117.00   -perks: about 2% to thank you and help spread the word!  $2,597.00   -indiegogo's campaign fee   $64,932.00   -TOTALAny additional amounts will go toward future projects, as well as any unanticipated expenses involved in bringing KwikFoot(tm) to market.                    My passion: Empowerment Engineering
   The most under-utilized resource in the world must be human potential.  With every engineering choice, we can encourage individual excellence, or exploit human weakness.  My name is Gordon Belles.  After studying Mechanical Engineering at Washington State U, Liberal Arts at Grace College and Physics at Purdue, and working in product development and engineering at Irwin Research and Development, Gulfstream Coach and Colbin Tool Company, my wife Cindy and I chose to start American Independence Technologies LLC to bring to life products which help us all be our best; story:
hello@getperfectmemory.com

 

The Perfect Memory camera is precision built out of military grade metal - a great experience with every touch. It is designed to be used everyday, superb video quality and small enough to carry in your pocket while packing pro features. 

 

Can your camera save video after the fact? Perfect Memory can. One of its advanced, patented features allows you to save video highlights on the go - after the events transpired - a "real life DVR". With the free iOS/Android app, you can instantly share your photos/videos on social media.

 

You can use the Perfect Memory camera in many ways: set it to timelapse photos/videos, connect it to your pet, wear as a necklace, or use it with any number of sports action mounts - the possibilities are endless.

 
Carry it everyday, easily fits in your pocket. 
 
 

Capture the elusive magic moments.
Perfect for capturing your Pokémon GO.
Use as an every day personal bodycam.
 

The Journey Behind Perfect Memory

Development began in 2015 to build the perfect camera from scratch, undergoing numerous iterations to achieve the operation and design of the finished Perfect Memory camera today.

Our team is comprised of wireless video camera manufacturing experts: industrial, electrical and computer engineers, as well as consumer product specialists and production managers, located in the USA, Asia, and Europe who have worked for Philips Electronics, IBM, AMD, Spansion and ASML. We created Perfect Memory to connect people together because photos & videos are a way to share our lives and experiences.  


 

FAQ

 

 

 

1. Hey, I'm thinking of getting one but it says it records the last five minutes - can I record for as long as I want?

Yes, you can record video for as long as you want - there is no limit on the size of your video file recording.  The camera is "dual mode": it can be used regularly to record video/snap photos with the built-in control buttons or using the smartphone app; or you can set it to advanced recording modes such as Timelapse Photo/Video, AutoEdit, and Car loop mode.  "The last five minutes" refers to an optional, advanced feature of the camera allowing you to save video after the fact. 

 

2. How do I control my Perfect Memory camera?

Either with the built in buttons that allow you to power on the camera, record video or snap photos, or with the free companion iOS/Android app.

3. Is it easy to use the Perfect Memory camera?

Yes, simply power on the camera and start recording video with a press of a button.  Or connect it to your smartphone and select additional modes to allow your camera to operate automatically so you can record hands-free.

4. What is the battery lifetime of the camera and how quickly does it recharge?

The 1,000 mAh battery take 1.5 hours to recharge.  Depending on the mode of use, you can operate the camera for several days without needing to recharge. In continuous video recording mode (no WiFi), you would have four hours.  With maximum power consumption - continuous WiFi and video recording - you would have two hours.

 

5. Does it have sound?

Yes, it has audio with the built-in microphone.

6. Are the Silver Metal and the Rose Gold Limited Edition Metal cameras the same model, apart from the different finishes?

Yes, the only difference between the two are the metal finishes.  The Limited Edition Rose Gold is more "gold" than "rose". 

7. How to I set the camera and are the settings saved after the camera powers off?

Yes, the settings you save to the camera using the companion iOS/Android app will be saved in the camera's memory so you will not need to set them again upon powering on the camera.

8. How many settings can I run at one time? 

You can set your camera to one mode of operation at any given time - for example regular recording, Timelapse, AutoEdit, car DVR loop mode.  You can always snap either a photo or record a video of any length.

9. What is AutoEdit and what is patented about it?

AutoEdit is a proprietary advanced mode that you can select to tap the camera to save up to the last five minutes of video (you can also change the duration). It is exclusively available only with the Perfect Memory camera under a new, recently issued United State utility patent. 

10. How do I set the camera to Timelapse modes?

You can set the camera to do Photo or Video timelapses using the companion iOS/Android app, to the time intervals of your choice.

11. How do you attach the camera to different surfaces?

With the accessories, you will be able to turn any number of surfaces into a photo/video "booth". 

12. How do you attach the camera to sports action mounts?

With the sports action mount frame shown above that will be optionally offered to those that would like to use it, you will be able to attach the camera to any sports action mount.  

13. Can it be used as a pet wearable camera and how?

Yes, it is easily attachable to dogs, and even cats.  The camera lens is stable so you will be able to see in superb quality what your loved pet is up to. 

14. Is the camera lightweight and how much does it weigh?

Yes, it is lightweight, and weighs 1.8oz or about 52 grams.

15. How is the camera different from a GoPro?

GoPro has several models, its newest model is the Session.  The Perfect Memory camera is 2-3x smaller than the Session, made out of a luxury metal build, sleek, and features AutoEdit. It can be worn and used in ways the GoPro cannot, without sacrificing quality for size or versatility, while compatible with all GoPro's line of action mounts and accessories.

16. How is the camera different from the Narrative Clip 2?

1) Superior video quality than the Narrative Clip 2 - the A7LS75 chipset; 2) Build quality; 3) Your choice of modes; 4) AutoEdit recall feature; 5) You can use it with its sports action mounts; 6) Larger memory capacity; 7) Built-in audio microphone.

 

17. What is Perfect Memory?

Perfect Memory is the ability to recall images with vividness bordering on actual visual perception; "total recall"; also called "photographic memory".

18. Why did you name the camera "Perfect Memory"?

The camera allows you to save video after the fact, ie "go back in time" to save the events that already happened with the patented AutoEdit video.  Also, the camera takes the pain out of video recording on the go to help capture the perfect "moments" and perfect "memories".

19. Which microSD card should I use?

We've had users try a PNY 64GB class 10 microSD card and they have reported problems with it.  We therefore recommend to use a 16/32GB class 10 microSD card, and not to use a 64GB or higher card as we assess the issue.

All tooling and molds are complete, with the above video showing the tooling and an inside look at some of the manufacturing steps underway in the production of the Perfect Memory Camera.

 The Journey Behind Perfect Memory
Development began in 2015 to build the perfect camera from scratch, undergoing numerous iterations to achieve the operation and design of the finished Perfect Memory camera today.
Our team is comprised of wireless video camera manufacturing experts: industrial, electrical and computer engineers, as well as consumer product specialists and production managers, located in the USA, Asia, and Europe who have worked for Philips Electronics, IBM, AMD, Spansion and ASML. We created Perfect Memory to connect people together because photos & videos are a way to share our lives and experiences.  

 
FAQ
 
 
 
1. Hey, I'm thinking of getting one but it says it records the last five minutes - can I record for as long as I want?
Yes, you can record video for as long as you want - there is no limit on the size of your video file recording.  The camera is "dual mode": it can be used regularly to record video/snap photos with the built-in control buttons or using the smartphone app; or you can set it to advanced recording modes such as Timelapse Photo/Video, AutoEdit, and Car loop mode.  "The last five minutes" refers to an optional, advanced feature of the camera allowing you to save video after the fact. 
 
2. How do I control my Perfect Memory camera?
Either with the built in buttons that allow you to power on the camera, record video or snap photos, or with the free companion iOS/Android app.
3. Is it easy to use the Perfect Memory camera?
Yes, simply power on the camera and start recording video with a press of a button.  Or connect it to your smartphone and select additional modes to allow your camera to operate automatically so you can record hands-free.
4. What is the battery lifetime of the camera and how quickly does it recharge?
The 1,000 mAh battery take 1.5 hours to recharge.  Depending on the mode of use, you can operate the camera for several days without needing to recharge. In continuous video recording mode (no WiFi), you would have four hours.  With maximum power consumption - continuous WiFi and video recording - you would have two hours.
 
5. Does it have sound?
Yes, it has audio with the built-in microphone.
6. Are the Silver Metal and the Rose Gold Limited Edition Metal cameras the same model, apart from the different finishes?
Yes, the only difference between the two are the metal finishes.  The Limited Edition Rose Gold is more "gold" than "rose". 
7. How to I set the camera and are the settings saved after the camera powers off?
Yes, the settings you save to the camera using the companion iOS/Android app will be saved in the camera's memory so you will not need to set them again upon powering on the camera.
8. How many settings can I run at one time? 
You can set your camera to one mode of operation at any given time - for example regular recording, Timelapse, AutoEdit, car DVR loop mode.  You can always snap either a photo or record a video of any length.
9. What is AutoEdit and what is patented about it?
AutoEdit is a proprietary advanced mode that you can select to tap the camera to save up to the last five minutes of video (you can also change the duration). It is exclusively available only with the Perfect Memory camera under a new, recently issued United State utility patent. 
10. How do I set the camera to Timelapse modes?
You can set the camera to do Photo or Video timelapses using the companion iOS/Android app, to the time intervals of your choice.
11. How do you attach the camera to different surfaces?
With the accessories, you will be able to turn any number of surfaces into a photo/video "booth". 
12. How do you attach the camera to sports action mounts?
With the sports action mount frame shown above that will be optionally offered to those that would like to use it, you will be able to attach the camera to any sports action mount.  
13. Can it be used as a pet wearable camera and how?
Yes, it is easily attachable to dogs, and even cats.  The camera lens is stable so you will be able to see in superb quality what your loved pet is up to. 
14. Is the camera lightweight and how much does it weigh?
Yes, it is lightweight, and weighs 1.8oz or about 52 grams.
15. How is the camera different from a GoPro?
GoPro has several models, its newest model is the Session.  The Perfect Memory camera is 2-3x smaller than the Session, made out of a luxury metal build, sleek, and features AutoEdit. It can be worn and used in ways the GoPro cannot, without sacrificing quality for size or versatility, while compatible with all GoPro's line of action mounts and accessories.
16. How is the camera different from the Narrative Clip 2?
1) Superior video quality than the Narrative Clip 2 - the A7LS75 chipset; 2) Build quality; 3) Your choice of modes; 4) AutoEdit recall feature; 5) You can use it with its sports action mounts; 6) Larger memory capacity; 7) Built-in audio microphone.
 
17. What is Perfect Memory?
Perfect Memory is the ability to recall images with vividness bordering on actual visual perception; "total recall"; also called "photographic memory".
18. Why did you name the camera "Perfect Memory"?
The camera allows you to save video after the fact, ie "go back in time" to save the events that already happened with the patented AutoEdit video.  Also, the camera takes the pain out of video recording on the go to help capture the perfect "moments" and perfect "memories".
19. Which microSD card should I use?
We've had users try a PNY 64GB class 10 microSD card and they have reported problems with it.  We therefore recommend to use a 16/32GB class 10 microSD card, and not to use a 64GB or higher card as we assess the issue.

All tooling and molds are complete, with the above video showing the tooling and an inside look at some of the manufacturing steps underway in the production of the Perfect Memory Camera.

story:
The iBeat Heart Alert & Emergency Watch is a sleek and stylish smart watch that can save your life. By perpetually monitoring for oncoming life-threatening heart incidents such as cardiac arrest (a sudden, sometimes temporary, cessation of heart function) or atrial fibrillation (an irregular, often rapid heart rate that can cause poor blood flow and lead to stroke), the iBeat Heart Alert & Emergency Watch ensures you receive immediate care in the event of a life-threatening emergency. We are still preparing for manufacturing so your early purchase gives you a 70% discount and a free year of monitoring.

​

FAQ

1. When will the smartwatch be shipped?

We will begin shipping devices in July 2017. Check back on our website and our Indiegogo page for the latest updates!

2. How much will the monthly monitoring cost?

After your free year of monitoring, the iBeat watch monthly monitoring fee will be $17. There is no commitment to sign up, but should you choose to continue the monitoring service, we will notify you that your service needs renewal, and you or a family member can pay this via credit card, PayPal, or check on our secure, online dashboard. We will also support automatic payments and split payments between friends/family members.

3. How does the watch work?

Hypersensitive PPG (photoplethysmogram) sensors continually monitor your heart for life-threatening emergencies, particularly ones that could cause sudden cardiac arrest or a heart attack. The device will be calibrated to each individual user's heartbeat so we can set a proper baseline for what constitutes as a “normal range" and what constitutes as “life-threatening.” If the device detects an oncoming life-threatening incident, it will ask the user if he or she is okay. If the user selects ‘No’ or is unresponsive for more than ten seconds, iBeat will notify the user’s emergency contacts and if necessary, 911. The watch will always ask you if you're having an emergency before taking action to dispatch 911. If it's a false alarm, you'll have ten seconds to tap the watch and say you're okay before we escalate.

4. How can I select which color device I want?

At the end of the campaign, we will reach out to you via email and you may select your iBeat watch color choice(s).

5. Who can wear the iBeat Life Monitor?

The iBeat watch strap can be adjusted ensuring a comfortable fit for wrists of all sizes, but the current version of the iBeat Life Monitor works best on wrists at least 5 inches or larger in circumference.

6. Do I need a cell phone or cellular plan to use this?

No, the iBeat watch has built-in cellular connectivity and is included in the monthly monitoring service fee.

7. What conditions does the iBeat Life Monitor detect for?

Our medical-grade sensors continually monitor your heart for slowing, stopping, or irregular beating that may trigger a life-threatening emergency. The device will be calibrated to each individual user's heart beat so we can make sure we set a proper baseline for what constitutes "normal". For those with an above-average heart rate due to A-fib, for example, we can set the emergency threshold a bit higher or lower depending on the user’s preference. Additionally, the watch will always ask you if you're having an emergency before taking action to dispatch 911. If it's a false alarm, you'll have ten seconds to tap the watch and say you're okay before we escalate. The device is not intended to diagnose, treat, mitigate, cure, or prevent any disease or condition, but is rather a notification device that can immediately alert family, loved ones, and emergency respondents in the case of an emergency.

8. Can people with pacemakers use this?

The iBeat watch operates similar to a cell phone and users with pacemakers should follow guidance from their doctor. It is not meant to replace your pacemaker or defibrillator.

9. How do the family and friend member alerts work?

When you buy an iBeat, you may set up your emergency contacts in our online dashboard. In the case of an emergency, your contacts will be notified via text message, or a call from our dispatch team.

10. How does the battery charging work?

The iBeat watch lasts 5-7 days before needing to be recharged. The device comes with an attachable battery that easily clips on to the side of the watch face, allowing you to wear the watch 24-7, even while charging it. The iBeat Life Monitor only takes one hour to charge. Once your device is fully charged, the battery pack can be plugged into a wall outlet or your USB drive. 

11. I’m not tech savvy. Is it easy to set up and use?

Very easy! The iBeat watch comes with large-font, easy-to-follow instructions for setup, and should take no longer than five minutes to get up and running.

12. Can I shower or swim with it?

Yes! The iBeat watch is meant to be worn 24/7 so it is water resistant and can be worn while showering, surfing, swimming, bathing, washing your hands, partaking in ice bucket challenges, etc.

13. Does the watch offer any integration with texting, calendar, tasks, etc. that other smartwatches have?

The iBeat watchwas designed to be a stylish timepiece that can save your life. It does not come pre-loaded with apps, or notify you of calls or text messages like other smartwatches. Instead, it functions more like a traditional watch with added features including customized watch faces, tracking your steps, setting an alarm or a timer, while continually monitoring and analyzing your heart for oncoming life-threatening emergencies. 

14. What if you are wearing the device in a no cell coverage area? Will it still work?

The iBeat watch does not need cell coverage to continually monitor and analyze your heart rate, but in an emergency, the device's ability to contact our dispatch team and 911 is dependent on cell connection. Should you happen to be in a no coverage area during an emergency, the device can send out an audible beacon that can alert anyone in your local area.

15. Is it safe to wear on my wrist all day and night?

Of course! The iBeat watch was designed to be worn around-the-clock, and it's an FCC and carrier-certified device that transmits far less frequencies than a standard cell phone. The sensor technology has been thoroughly tested, and it is completely safe to wear on your wrist and skin.

16. Does the device support multiple profiles so that it can be used or shared by more than one person?

Unfortunately, the iBeat watch is a single profile device. When you receive your iBeat, the device will analyze you routine heart rate rhythms and patterns and calibrate itself accordingly. This is how we establish a safe baseline, and also why we offer the iBeat Family Deal...you get two devices for a steal of a deal!

17. Are there plans to offer different colored straps and bands in the near future?

Absolutely! The first version of the iBeat watch will come with a standard black or white silicone-based band that can be adjusted to your wrist size. We plan to add more bands in different colors and materials sometime next year.

18. I'm worried about false alarms. Can I control, or turn off the 911 alerts?

In the event of an emergency, the iBeat watch will always ask you if you're having an emergency before taking action to dispatch 911. If it's a false alarm, you'll have ten seconds to tap the watch and say you're okay before we escalate. Additionally, the watch will notify our dispatch team who can then field the call to 911, preventing any unnecessary false 911 calls.

19. Will I be able to access my health data and share with my doctor?

You, your doctor, or anyone else that you authorize may access our secure online dashboard where you can view your data data including your daily, weekly, and monthly heart rates and patterns, as well as download the raw data.

20. Does iBeat work internationally or offer multi-language support, and where do you ship?

Currently, the iBeat watch is only available in the United States, but we are happy to ship your device anywhere around the world. In the near future, we plan to offer an international version of iBeat with multi-language support.

21. What is the return policy?

If you or a family member do not feel safer wearing this device, simply return it within 90 days, no questions asked, and we will refund your money.

22. How do I buy?

  1. Decide which color iBeat watch you want: rose gold with white strap OR gunmetal black with black strap
  2. Go to the column on the right and click the pink button that says, "GET THIS PERK."
  3. Fill out your shipping information - make sure you select "United States" for country
  4. Complete billing information
  5. You'll receive a confirmation email from noreply@indiegogo.com
  6. Any questions? Call or email us: support@ibeat.com or 415-496-9682

story:
A year ago, B. Meads Designs was launched from the Shelby Walking Bridge in Nashville, TN. Now after dozens of fashion shows, publication exposure and countless signature pieces, B. Meads Designs is coming home to Florida for an exclusive show for the family and friends who inspired my journey.

I have been so overwhelming blessed to be able to represent my collections in Nashville and Atlanta but have not had the opportunity to showcase in my hometown.  This show will allow me to display my new collections as well as show all those that supported me the result of all their prayers, words of encouragement and faith in this unexpected journey.

My friends and family have been the best supporters anyone can ask for and they deserve the best fashion show I can give them, so all contributions will go to the successful completion of this exclusive fashion show.

With your help we can bring B. Meads Designs back home to the people that love it most.

story:
Our Idea?

Every day we come across lot of people wearing oddly fitted clothing. There is no option for them, except buying what many popular brands offer. It is like a black and white movie. Nobody stands out. We can change that. YOU can change that. We strongly feel that every man and woman is unique and this uniqueness should be reflected on the clothing range they wear. So, we ask you, are you ready for a change?

Let’s change then! We want men and women around the globe to be able to design their own apparel and flaunt them. Wearing dresses is a basic necessity of life and can also be used to express your unique style. But have you noticed how you pick up your styling? You are often overlooked in a sea of mass produced trends. We don´t want this to keep happening to people, especially to you!

We want to bring the power of custom design and fit options to your fingertips and mindsets. We want you to visualize yourself using different outfit combinations, picking up or inventing your own style. Bring style to life!


Our Pledge

We want to provide a hassle free and enjoyable custom design and fit options to shoppers across the globe with the widest range of collections from leading mills.

Designing a dress is as easy as having a cup of coffee and as enjoyable as playing a video game.

We are committed to sponsor brand new school uniforms for selected Orphanages/Government Schools in and around Andhra Pradesh, India. Every perk you buy lights up an under privileged child's life with sparkling smile. In return, you will receive a beautiful photograph of those children which is priceless.

Let's come together and join hands to make these smiles forever. These amazing children deserves new school uniforms once in a while.

Our Quality

Every customized order should pass our quality process and mechanism before shipping to our customers. Failure or non compliance to the procedural checks will result in donating the order(s) to charitable entities associated with us.

              

Our Edge

  • A perfect blend of best Indian ethnicity and vogue across the globe.
  • Wide range of collection from leading mills.
  • Perfectly customized apparel for the entire family.
  • Prices of customized apparel are on par with retail ready-to-wear apparel.
  • We are committed to finding the right balance between price and quality.
  • Our dedicated sourcing team specializes in active clothing for all types of people.

            

Some of our Exquisite Collection in Men's section.

Some of our Alluring Collection in Women's section.


Who We Are 

Thayari.com, is a division of INNOVISTA Technologies Pvt. Ltd, aimed at providing hassle free shopping experience. Our team comes from an extensive background in creating mission critical applications and adding value to the products. Our team also shares a common interest in fashion and social awareness and always brainstorms on how to improve the living standards of the community around us.

After many brainstorming sessions, we have decided to venture in to fashion eCommerce and bring the process of apparel design from big sophisticated design studios to your finger tips, the ultimate decision maker of your style, fit and outlook.

Our mission is to bring the power of custom design and fit options to your finger tips.

The Team:

Ravindra, Co-founder and CEO: Ravindra is a proficient technocrat & entrepreneur with an eye for market needs, and an ability to bring teams together. He believes in speaking less and delivering more. Ravindra loves long drives, reading books and follows world fashion keenly.

MSR, Co-founder and CTO: M. Srinivas Rao, fondly called MSR, brings enormous experience of technical brilliance to the core of software development. MSR leads our team of technology and delivery experts in delivering integrated business solutions. MSR loves to study current affairs, reading books and drinks lot of green tea.

Srinivas, Co-founder and Head of Services: Srinivas is an Internet/Technology Enthusiast and aspiring entrepreneur. He dreams to build a successful internet business. Srinivas loves reading books, travel hill stations and follows world of fashion especially Indian ethnic fashion.


Our customers are talking!!

In this busy world, that too living in abroad; choosing a formal wear is a bland task. With the ready-made ones I feel as if I am wearing others’ garments.  I never found a ready-made shirt with proportionate shoulder, neck and sleeve sizes.  To my surprise I have found one place, Thayari, where I could find fabric of my choice, dress fits my body measurements and interestingly for an affordable price. Don’t believe it! Believe it!! - MRK, Australia.

I received my shirt and am impressed with the perfect stitching and very good packing. Completely satisfied with the services of Thayari.com. Thanks for the perfection. Keep it up and ready to order some more… - Veeru Kakarapalli , India.


What we need from you?

Since inception we have self funded the research and development activities of the project, website development and initial inventory, also all future development activities will be funded internally by our team, but now it is the time to scale up our business.

We need to raise $50,000 which helps us to use in below forms:

-  $35,000 will be used to acquire new inventory to the store;

-  $10,000 will be used to hire new designers;

-  $5,000 will be used in marketing/branding and promotion of our website.

The core part of the entire campaign is to add more inventory to our store, so that shoppers can have a huge variety of dresses to choose from. Also we would like to bring some professional designers on-board in order to help customers in designing dresses and help them with the right fit.

The project will be launched within a month after funding campaign on Indiegogo ends.

How should we reward you?

We want you to fund us and design your own wear! Every funding member is entitled to get a gift certificate worth of same amount funded plus fabulous discounts on all future purchases with www.thayari.com. The more you fund, the more discounts you get from our store.

We will also proudly display your name on our website under a special 'Thank You Page' in appropriate perk category.


FAQ

Where are we located?

All operations are handled from our Hyderabad, India office. Certain tasks like stitching, embroidery, packing etc will be outsourced to self help groups in and around Hyderabad under a program called DWCRA.


What is DWCRA?

A statewide poverty reduction project consists of women from financially backward communities. Thayari.com aims to provide livelihood to them by outsourcing different works to them.

What is a Perfect Fit Dress?

A ‘Perfect Fit Dress’ is the one that you can design yourself right from scratch. From selecting your fabric to choosing your dress style from limitless options to the sizing of the dress which will be made exactly to your size, especially for you.

How can I redeem my perk?

4-weeks after the end of the campaign, you will receive your thayari.com gift certificate through email. Thereafter you could start redeeming your gift certificate on www.thayari.com by selecting apparel of your choice. You can also customize your apparel to suit your style & fit requirements.

When are the perks expected to ship?

Once you redeem your gift certificate on our website, it takes 2 weeks for us to start shipping the order(s)  to your shipping address.

How about international shipping?

Shipping of dresses purchased on thayari.com are free within India, for international shipping you may have to pay $15 extra per shipment if the cart value is less than $250.

What if dress/dresses I have selected cost more than the gift certificate I have?

You can buy any dress of your choice. However, if the cost of the dress exceeds the value of gift certificate that you have; you could pay the difference using various payment options available on www.thayari.com.

In Fashionista perk, what is "Brand of clothing range on your name"?

A clothing range shall be named on the name/initial you suggest. It can be a shirt/trouser to start with your own branding and lineage that could be the next "BRAND" for others to choose. Let say, NY will be initials named after New York.

We
want to bring the power of custom design and fit options to your fingertips and
mindsets. We want you to visualize yourself using different outfit
combinations, picking up or inventing your own style. Bring style to life!
Our Pledge
We
want to provide a hassle free and enjoyable custom design and fit options to
shoppers across the globe with the widest range of collections from leading
mills.
Designing
a dress is as easy as having a cup of coffee and as enjoyable as playing a
video game.We are committed to sponsor brand new school uniforms for selected Orphanages/Government
 Schools in and around Andhra Pradesh, India. Every perk you buy lights up an under 
privileged child's life with sparkling smile. In return, you will receive a
 beautiful photograph of those children which is priceless.Let's come together and join hands to make these smiles forever. These amazing children deserves new school uniforms once in a while.

Our Quality
Every customized order should pass our
quality process and mechanism before shipping to our customers. Failure or non compliance to the procedural checks will result in donating the order(s) to charitable entities associated with us.               Our Edge


A perfect blend of best Indian ethnicity and vogue
across the globe.

Wide range of collection from leading mills.

Perfectly customized apparel for the entire family.

Prices of customized apparel are on par with
retail ready-to-wear apparel.

We are committed to finding the right balance
between price and quality.

Our dedicated sourcing team specializes in
active clothing for all types of people.
             Some of our Exquisite Collection in Men's section.Some of our Alluring Collection in Women's section.Who
We Are  
Thayari.com,
is a division of INNOVISTA Technologies Pvt. Ltd, aimed at providing hassle
free shopping experience. Our team comes from an extensive background in
creating mission critical applications and adding value to the products. Our
team also shares a common interest in fashion and social awareness and always
brainstorms on how to improve the living standards of the community around us.
After
many brainstorming sessions, we have decided to venture in to fashion eCommerce
and bring the process of apparel design from big sophisticated design
studios to your finger tips, the ultimate decision maker of your style, fit and
outlook.
Our
mission is to bring the power of custom design and fit options to your finger
tips.
The
Team:

Ravindra, Co-founder
and CEO: Ravindra is a proficient technocrat &
entrepreneur with an eye for market needs, and an ability to bring teams
together. He believes in speaking less and delivering more. Ravindra loves long
drives, reading books and follows world fashion keenly.

MSR, Co-founder and CTO:
M. Srinivas Rao, fondly called MSR, brings enormous
experience of technical brilliance to the core of software development. MSR
leads our team of technology and delivery experts in delivering integrated
business solutions. MSR loves to study current affairs, reading books and drinks lot of green tea.

Srinivas, Co-founder
and Head of Services: Srinivas is an
Internet/Technology Enthusiast and aspiring entrepreneur. He dreams to build a
successful internet business. Srinivas loves reading books, travel hill
stations and follows world of fashion especially Indian ethnic fashion.
Our
customers are talking!!
In this busy world, that too living in abroad; choosing a formal
wear is a bland task. With the ready-made ones I feel as if I am wearing
others’ garments.  I never found a
ready-made shirt with proportionate shoulder, neck and sleeve sizes.  To my surprise I have found one place,
Thayari, where I could find fabric of my choice, dress fits my body
measurements and interestingly for an affordable price. Don’t believe it!
Believe it!! - MRK, Australia.
I received my shirt and am impressed with
the perfect stitching and very good packing. Completely satisfied with the
services of Thayari.com. Thanks for the perfection. Keep it up and ready to
order some more… - Veeru Kakarapalli ,
India.
What we need from you?
Since
inception we have self funded the research and development activities of the
project, website development and initial inventory, also all future development
activities will be funded internally by our team, but now it is the time to scale
up our business.
We
need to raise $50,000 which helps us to use in below forms:
- 
$35,000 will be used to acquire new inventory
to the store;
- 
$10,000 will be used to hire new designers;
- 
$5,000 will be used in marketing/branding and
promotion of our website.
The
core part of the entire campaign is to add more inventory to our store, so that
shoppers can have a huge variety of dresses to choose from. Also we would like
to bring some professional designers on-board in order to help customers in
designing dresses and help them with the right fit.
The project will be launched within a month
after funding campaign on Indiegogo ends.
How should we reward you?

We
want you to fund us and design your
own wear! Every funding member is entitled
to get a gift certificate worth of same amount funded plus fabulous discounts
on all future purchases with www.thayari.com. The more you fund, the more discounts you get from our store.We will also proudly display your name on our website under a special 'Thank You Page' in appropriate perk category.


FAQ
Where are we located?
All
operations are handled from our Hyderabad, India office. Certain tasks like
stitching, embroidery, packing etc will be outsourced to self help groups in
and around Hyderabad under a program called DWCRA.
What is DWCRA?

A statewide poverty reduction project consists
of women from financially backward communities. Thayari.com aims to provide
livelihood to them by outsourcing different works to them.
What is a Perfect Fit
Dress?
A
‘Perfect Fit Dress’ is the one that you can design yourself right from scratch.
From selecting your fabric to choosing your dress style from limitless options
to the sizing of the dress which will be made exactly to your size, especially
for you.
How can I redeem my
perk?
4-weeks after the end of the campaign, you will receive your thayari.com gift certificate through email. Thereafter you could start redeeming your gift certificate on www.thayari.com by selecting apparel of your choice. You can also customize your apparel to suit your style & fit requirements.
When are the perks expected to ship?
Once you redeem your gift certificate on our website, it takes 2 weeks for us to start shipping the order(s)  to your shipping address.

How about international shipping?
Shipping
of dresses purchased on thayari.com are free within India, for international
shipping you may have to pay $15 extra per shipment if the cart value is less
than $250.
What if dress/dresses I have selected cost more than the gift certificate I have?You can buy any dress of your choice. However, if the cost of the dress exceeds the value of gift certificate that you have; you could pay the difference using various payment options available on www.thayari.com. In Fashionista
perk, what is "Brand of clothing range on your name"?A clothing range shall be named on the 
name/initial you suggest. It can be a shirt/trouser to start with your 
own branding and lineage that could be the next "BRAND" for others to 
choose. Let say, NY will be initials named after
New York.

story:
Join The Movement


Transform Fashion Now

We’re producing volumes and volumes of clothing to  meet current trends but we’re not putting any emphasis on the importance of how we treat the people or the planet on the process of making these things. If we don't stop this immediately, we're not going to be able to keep on living like we do now.

Fashion Positive partners with brands and designers and their supply chain partners to create better materials for clothing that do not harm people or the planet in the process of making and producing. It's not easy to accomplish these big goals alone—so we created a movement.



The fashion industry is one of the most harmful and wasteful in the world. 


How is Fashion Positive fixing the problem?

Claire Vivier

Fashion Positive is powered by Cradle to Cradle Certified™, the most comprehensive program in the world that guides designers and manufacturers to make products in fundamentally better ways. 

Cradle to Cradle is a design methodology that says everything we use should be looked at as a nutrient for a future cycle.


Cradle to Cradle ensures that positive impact is made in five key areas:


Why Do We Need This Money?

We are collaborating with leading designers and brands, including G-Star RAW, Stella McCartney, Loomstate, Bionic Yarn, Belk department stores and their supply chain partners who will create better manufacturing processes and materials for our clothing. 

DOEN Foundation of the Dutch Postcode Lottery in the Nethelands in partnership with Wendy and Eric Schmidt have already provided the beginning balance to fund these initial projects.

WE NEED YOUR SUPPORT TO RAISE AN ADDITIONAL $100,000 AND COMPLETE FUNDING NEEDED FOR THESE PROJECTS.

THIS $100,000 WILL:

A.  Provide much needed innovation funding for 2-3 project partners who make materials  for apparel (e.g., yarns, fabrics, buttons, zippers, dyes, etc..).  

B.  Examples of how the money will be used are:

     i.   Optimize a mill's renewable energy profile.

     ii.  Improvements to current water and filtration system or other means for ensuring the recycling of clean water into the facility and providing clean effluent to local systems.  

     iii.   Creation of projects which improve social practices at the facility level, thus impacting the lives of workers and local community (e.g. education, training, fair wage, human rights, women's rights, etc...).

     iv.  Invest in materials take back, recycling or upcycling programs within the facilities, brands, retailers or across the entire supply chain  (e.g. creating a system for fibers to be recollected and spun into future yarns).

    v.   Green chemistry needs  (e.g. spur research and development for new innovations in better dyes, pigments and processing chemicals to lesson impact on people and planet).

Every dollar you donate will be used to ensure that these supply chain partners have the means to create better materials for our clothes.

$1 to $1 Match

We only need $100,000 to complete the balance needed to begin this work. Wendy and Eric Schmidt have generously committed to matching dollar-for-dollar every dollar you give. We need to raise $50,000 to be matched by Wendy and Eric Schmidt, totaling $100,000 needed to begin this important work. That's a total of $100,000 you will help us create for this work. 


The Campaign Team

Press

Mind, Body, Green: 10 Wellness Trends to Watch in 2015: Supply Chain Transparency in Fashion

Huffington Post: We're One Big Step Closer To A More Sustainable Fashion Industry, Thanks To This New Initiative

Forbes Life: Why Brands And Retailers Are Running With The 'Slow Fashion' Movement

Broadway World: Stella McCartney, G-Star RAW And Others Revolutionize The Industry With Fashion Positive

Forbes Life: Green Is The New Black: Fashion Industry Aims To Increase Sustainable Practices


What you get

Denim Carry-all ($25 USD)

Mecho Systems bag ($40 USD)

Fashion Positive branded t-shirt ($50 USD)


Loomstate 100% Organic Cotton Sunshine T ($50) 


Loomstate 100% Organic Cotton Act Natural T ($50) 


G-Star RAW For The Oceans Womens Quote T-Shirt Co-Designed by Pharrell Williams ($50)


G-Star RAW For The Oceans Mens Jellyfish Print T-Shirt Co-designed Pharrell Williams ($50)

Knotty Gal Necklace ($100) 


Puma Incycle Sneakers ($100 USD)


Puma Incycle Gym Bag ($250 USD)


Pendleton Eco-Wise Wool Blanket ($200 USD)


Under The Canopy Kimono Robes ($333 USD)


Claire Vivier Wallet ($400) 

Cradle to Cradle Certified Bag ($500) 


Kayu Purse ($600) 


Under The Canopy Metamorphosis GOTS Certified Bedding Set ($1111 USD)


Averti Custom Designed Cocktail Dress ($3000)





Other Ways to Give

  • Spread the word about #FashionPositive on Facebook (Fashion Positive C2C)  or Twitter @fashionpc2c
  • Become a Fashion Positive pioneer—spread the word about this Initative and share this Indiegogo campaign with everyone you know who wears clothes!
